intro: Zaluzianskya coriacea, commonly known as the woolly bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, gray-green foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to violet. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in rocky or alpine environments. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Zaluzianskya coriacea is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
